website_summaries.verdict: A supportive stability shoe great for those who need extra support.
pros: It's versatile in that it's comfortable to run and walk in
Mid-foot shank provides adequate stability, and cushioning is extremely comfortable
Shoe is also wide enough to fit most feet
cons: takes some time to break in

customer_reviews.title: alex radis
customer_reviews.text: The height of the left shoe heel was higher than right,they were squeaky and I received them in damaged shoe box,laces were untied,there was no paper inside of the shoes,it was obvious someone was wearing them,.Be careful when ordering without free return or no free return on select colors or sizes,since your chances to get item with issues are much higher.Other than this I don't understand why there is so many good reviews since this model by my opinion is just bit above average shoes in any aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Alex R

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfied to satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: The shoes didn't fit, we went to return them and found we were slightly beyond the allowed 30 day return period. I wrote an unsatisfactory review because of it, however Zappos made it right and so I am re-writing a new review to say there was nothing wrong with the shoes other than they didn't fit my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit
customer_reviews.text: Simply put I have big feet and use orthotics in my running shoes. I wear a 15 extra wide which I got these in. Usually with this size my feet have room to move and breathe and lace for perfect comfort. Not here. It was a squeeze to get my feet in and then the laces were way too short that I could not even double lace them. Very uncomfortable and in no way an option for my overpronation. I guess it is trial and error for personal preference with running shoes but these just did not work for me. I have worn the Brooks Beast in the past which fit much better.
customer_reviews.author: barry

customer_reviews.title: Like the '15
customer_reviews.text: Brooks has once again fumbled in the odd-numbered year of this shoe. Like the '15, the '17 tries to cradle the foot too much, which puts undue pressure on the whole foot, but especially on the outermost and innermost toes. While this effect is not quite as bad in the '17 as it was in the '15, Brooks added some stitched-on pieces in the front of the shoe, which further compress the toes. This type of thing is not acceptable in a long-distance running shoe. In the ONLY brand/model that still consistently carries a real EEEE shoe, it is unforgivable.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Materials Unfortunately Ruin An Otherwise Decent Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've been a loyal Brooks wearer for a few years now, but this newer model is made of very cheap materials. The fit was fine, and the shoe comfortable, but the shoe's rubber and paint started peeling within the first week of use. My first pair I exchanged due to a manufacturing defect (a poor seam), and the second I simply returned because it was falling apart. It's a shame my local running store only stocks the latest model of each brand, because I feel the GTS 16s were a better shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Travane Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: ) like the other color combo so it fit completely different
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the Metallic Charcoal/Black/Tawny Port and wanted a different color for workout shoes. Well they don't list the Heather/Anthracite/Primer Grey ones are a different material that is not as breathable (almost water resistant?) like the other color combo so it fit completely different. It was tight on my foot and of course they didn't do half sizes so back they went.
customer_reviews.author: CoveGirl

customer_reviews.title: Fabric quality has declined
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of Brooks GTS I've had, the first being the GTS 12. The latter are over 5 year old by now and, apart from the cushion worn out due to extensive use - the reason I purchased the GTS 17, they look like new. These GTS 17, however have ripped along the sides on both shoes after less than a year. The fabric quality feels inferior to the GTS12, making me suspect Brooks have tried to save money. I've looked at the GTS 18 as a replacement, but the material feels even more flimsy than the 17. So at the moment I'm looking at the Mitzuno Inspire or Asics Gel Kayano.
customer_reviews.author: Magnus  S

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to really gush about these shoes but cannot.
customer_reviews.text: Really like these shoes because they are and continue to be a good supportive shoe, ALTHOUGH, have owned for less than 3 months and they are falling apart. I'm not a mega exercise person, but do a bit of walking each day and for the high price you would expect them to last at least 6 months or more (tread coming off and worn out). Will be going back to a different brand that lasted MUCH longer for about 30% less$$.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: They are extremely comfortable. Loved the comfort
customer_reviews.text: Must have got a lemon pair the tred stripped right away. Several places on the edges. Both shoes in the pair. I normally buy saucony but wanted an all black. For a trip to europe. So i could also use for a dressier look. So I didn't have to bring multiple pair of shoes. They are extremely comfortable. Loved the comfort. And fit similar fit to saucony. But they started to de glue immediately. Very unhappy for $120
customer_reviews.author: Brandon K.

customer_reviews.title: 151 miles and need a new pair. I weigh ...
customer_reviews.text: 151 miles and need a new pair. I weigh around 170lbs and wore through the rubber faster than other pairs. On a positive not, they didn't really need any break in. They also run small. I wear a 10 in almost everything, needed 10.5
customer_reviews.author: Se

customer_reviews.title: Tried these instead of the glycerin 14 to save a ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried these instead of the glycerin 14 to save a few dollars. Injured toe while braking in. Lower arch support strained my foot a bit. Ended up buying glycerin anyway. Will use these for casual ware but done running with them
customer_reviews.author: Stephen schaeberle

product_meta.title: Brooks Men's Adrenaline Gts 17
product_meta.description:
Brooks Men's Adrenaline Gts 17

Mesh

Rubber sole

Breathable, flexible mesh and structurally supportive synthetic upper materials

Adjustable, asymmetrical mid-foot saddle creates a more secure, customizable fit

Comfortable fabric lining offers a great in-shoe feel

Removable molded foam insole supplies light underfoot cushioning

BioMoGo DNA has a gender-friendly cushioning design, making for a dynamic ride
feature_bullets: Breathable, flexible mesh and structurally supportive synthetic upper materials
Adjustable, asymmetrical mid-foot saddle creates a more secure, customizable fit
Comfortable fabric lining offers a great in-shoe feel
